attributes.action: Change the law to make credit reference agencies always seek the subject's (private individual) agreement to release information when they receive a credit reference request.  This
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The law should be altered to make credit reference information held by the agencies the property of the subject - i.e., the private individual.  The agencies should not be able to respond to a credit reference enquiry without first checking separately (i.e. not rely on a signature on an application form) with the individual whether the request can be responded to.  This would reduce the opportunity for fraudsters to take over an individual's identity and obtain credit.
Making the data held the property of the individual should also lead to an obligation on the agencies to provide free access, by the individual, to their reference data, rather than the chargeable access that currently exists.
